page.title: 13BLAYDON'S AMBULANCE SERVICE.
page.content: The ambulance service in Blaydon has seven ambulances. They are recognisable by their colours of white with red stripes along their sides. The two drivers we spoke to said that they have more doctor or house calls to make than emergencies. There are eleven men at Blaydon Station who all work shifts. The "emergency" van is equipped with three sorts of oxygen, antiseptic spray, bandages, bowls, splints, gauze, savlon, neck collars, arm slings, a rescue box, bed-pan and breathing aparatus. There are also two stretchers and some maternity wear which they use very rarely. The ambulance has many lights, and a two way radio to keep in contact with the station. The ambulance has a maximum speed of eighty mile an hour and has a siren to warn traffic as it goes to emergencies.
